newsitem.title: UK: Ford hit by financial reporting gaps - paper.
newsitem.headline: Ford hit by financial reporting gaps - paper.

text.p: Ford Motor Co's financial health in Europe and Brazil has probably been misrepresented due to glitches in its financial reporting systems, the Wall Street Journal on Thursday quoted the company as saying.

Jacques Nasser, president of worldwide automotive operations, said it would probably be three to six months before the company's financial reporting systems could catch up with a global product development reorganisation.
The Wall Street Journal quoted sources close to Ford as saying it lost $472 million in Europe in the third quarter, about $250 million more than anticipated.
Ford losses in South America widened to $226 million in the third quarter from losses of $102 million a year earlier, the paper said.
